content:
TITLE: Initializing SolidStart Project with Package Managers
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to create a SolidStart application and run a development server using npm, pnpm, or Bun. It includes steps for creating a directory, initializing the project, installing dependencies, and starting the development server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir my-app
cd my-app

# with npm
npm init solid@latest
npm install
npm run dev

# or with pnpm
pnpm create solid@latest
pnpm install
pnpm dev

# or with Bun
bun create solid@latest
bun install
bun dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing New SolidStart Project with NPM
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create, set up, and start a new SolidStart application. The sequence includes project initialization, dependency installation, and launching the development server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/packages/start/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm init solid@latest my-app
cd my-app
npm install
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing pnpm for SolidStart Development
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to install pnpm globally using npm. pnpm is the recommended package manager for the SolidStart monorepo.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install -g pnpm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a SolidStart Project with npm init
DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize a new SolidStart project using npm. The first command creates a project in the current directory, while the second creates a project in a new directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/with-trpc/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# create a new project in the current directory
npm init solid@latest

# create a new project in my-app
npm init solid@latest my-app
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the SolidStart Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start the development server after project creation and dependency installation. The second command also opens the application in a new browser tab.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/with-trpc/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev

# or start the server and open the app in a new browser tab
npm run dev -- --open
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running SolidStart Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start the development server, with an option to automatically open the app in a new browser tab.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/with-unocss/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev

# or start the server and open the app in a new browser tab
npm run dev -- --open
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting SolidStart Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start the development server for a SolidStart project. Includes an option to automatically open the app in a new browser tab. Assumes dependencies have been installed using npm, pnpm, or yarn.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/bare/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev

# or start the server and open the app in a new browser tab
npm run dev -- --open
```

TITLE: Creating a SolidStart Project using npm
DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize a new SolidStart project either in the current directory or in a specified folder. Uses the 'npm init' command with the 'solid@latest' argument.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/todomvc/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

# create a new project in my-app
npm init solid@latest my-app
```

LANGUAGE: bash

TITLE: Running All Tests in the Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute all tests in the solid-start project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm run test:all
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:


TITLE: Running the HackerNews Example Application
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the HackerNews example application in development mode using PNPM workspace filtering.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm --filter example-hackernews run dev
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Counter Component in SolidJS
DESCRIPTION: Imports a Counter component from the local components directory and renders it within a markdown template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/with-mdx/src/routes/index.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import Counter from "~/components/Counter";
```

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<Counter />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Counter Component in SolidJS
DESCRIPTION: This code imports the Counter component from the components directory using the tilde (~) path alias, which typically points to the src directory in a SolidJS project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/with-mdx/src/routes/about.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import Counter from "~/components/Counter";
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using HttpStatusCode Component in SolidJS
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import and implement the HttpStatusCode component from @solidjs/start to set a 404 status code for a page not found scenario.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/with-mdx/src/routes/[...404].mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { HttpStatusCode } from "@solidjs/start";

<HttpStatusCode code={404} />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for AuthJS in SolidStart
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the required environment variables for setting up AuthJS with Discord OAuth in a SolidStart project. It includes Discord credentials, authentication secret, and URL configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/with-authjs/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
- `DISCORD_ID`=
- `DISCORD_SECRET`=
- `AUTH_SECRET`=b198e07a64406260b98f06e21c457b84
- `AUTH_TRUST_HOST`=true
- `AUTH_URL`=http://localhost:3000
- `VITE_AUTH_PATH`=/api/auth
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access for SolidStart Project
DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt file sets rules for web crawlers accessing a SolidStart project. It allows all user agents to access all paths on the site.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/packages/landing-page/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
User-Agent: *
Allow: /
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Default Robot Access Rules
DESCRIPTION: Configures default access rules for web crawlers through robots.txt. Allows unrestricted access to all user agents with no disallowed paths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/solidjs/solid-start/blob/main/examples/hackernews/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: txt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```
